item.title: Do your leaders need this AI course?
item.dc:creator: Cassie Kozyrkov
item.content:encoded:
(Yes.)

HBR estimates 80% of AI projects fail. Donâ€™t let your projects meet thisÂ fate.

There are two ways to implement AI in your organization:

  1. Create frameworks to build & deploy enterprise automation systems atÂ scale
  2. Leverage the right AI tools to fuel productivity and efficiency

Iâ€™ve created a new course to help business leaders and aspiring leaders kick their bad AI habits. If you can think of someone whoâ€™ll benefit from some enterprise AI savvy, please share this enrollment link with them: ğŸŒŸhttps://bit.ly/cassiemaven1ğŸŒŸ

In the course, Iâ€™ll break down everything you need to know about safely implementing AI in your enterprise and actually driving revenue. The course features lectures from my friends Dan Guido and Nick Sonnenberg (scroll down for bios), each a leading expert on one of these two polar approaches to enterprise AI.

The first cohort starts ğŸŒŸtomorrowğŸŒŸ andÂ covers:

  • How to evaluate AI use cases within yourÂ company
  • Frameworks for ideating, scoping, testing, and deploying AIÂ systems
  • AI illusions to avoid and how to set AI expectations in yourÂ org
  • How GenAI systems differ from traditional machineÂ learning
  • Leveraging AI tools for more efficient, productive orgs
  • Keeping your companyâ€™s data safe andÂ secure
  • Evaluating vendors and working with external AIÂ systems
  • Combining the right skillsets and roles to build the data team youÂ need
  • â€¦ and much, muchÂ more

Join us for live teaching sessions and liveÂ Q+As.

Enroll here: ğŸŒŸhttps://bit.ly/cassiemaven1ğŸŒŸ

About the lecturers

For those who havenâ€™t met meÂ yet

Cassie Kozyrkov pioneered the field of Decision Intelligence and served as Googleâ€™s first Chief Decision Scientist, advised senior leadership on decision process, AI strategy, and building data-driven organizations. She combines an academic background in mathematical statistics, psychology, and cognitive neuroscience with a decade of executive experience at Google to help leaders optimize their biggest decisions and leverage data to drive better business outcomes. Known for her entertaining courses, Cassie personally trained over 20,000 Googlers in data-driven decision-making. One of her most popular courses has been viewed over 150,000 times on YouTube. Cassie also writes extensively on AI, data science, and decision making. Her writing has garnered an audience of over a million followers across her social channels and Medium blog. Cassie is a sought after keynote speaker for global tech conferences and Fortune 500 companies.

Dan Guido

Dan Guido is the CEO of Trail of Bits, a cybersecurity firm he founded in 2012 to address software security challenges with cutting-edge research. In his tenure leading Trail of Bits, Dan has grown the team to 80 engineers, led the team to compete in the DARPA Cyber Grand Challenge, built an industry-leading blockchain security practice, and refined open-source tools for the endpoint security market. In addition to his work at Trail of Bits, heâ€™s active on the boards of four early-stage technology companies. Dan contributes to cybersecurity policy papers from RAND, CNAS, and Harvard. He runs Empire Hacking, a 1,500-member meetup group focused on NYC-area cybersecurity professionals. His latest hobby coding projectâ€Šâ€”â€ŠAlgoVPNâ€Šâ€”â€Šis the Internetâ€™s most recommended self-hosted VPN. In prior roles, Dan taught a capstone course on software exploitation at NYU as a faculty member and the Hacker in Residence, consulted at iSEC Partners (now NCC Group), and worked as an incident responder for the Federal ReserveÂ System.

Nick Sonnenberg

Nick Sonnenberg is the founder and CEO of Leverage, a business efficiency consultant, Inc. columnist and author of the book Idea to Execution. His book, Come Up for Air, is a WSJ bestseller. As a serial entrepreneur with a passion for productivity and a background in data science, Nickâ€™s mission is to create companies that disrupt the way people work by leveraging the power of outsourcing, remote teams, common tools, and automation. Nick has worked with individuals and companies of all sizes, including Tony Robbins, Jay Abraham, Joe Polish, Ethereum andÂ more.

Bonus funÂ fact

Iâ€™ve known Dan about an hour longer than Nick, since I met them at the same party in New York a few years ago. It hadnâ€™t occurred to me until a moment ago that itâ€™s a fun coincidence that I know my favorite efficiency expert and my favorite security expert thanks to one particular rooftop.

Join us or share this link with someone whoâ€™llÂ benefit:

ğŸŒŸhttps://bit.ly/cassiemaven1ğŸŒŸ

item.title: Hereâ€™s to a brilliant 2024!
item.dc:creator: Cassie Kozyrkov
item.content:encoded:
A personal update for myÂ readers

Happy new year, dear friends! If youâ€™ve never encountered me before, whoops, sorryâ€Šâ€”â€Šthis blog post is probably not the place to start getting to know one another. This oneâ€™s for my friends and followers who have been wondering what Iâ€™ve gotten up to since my big career change last year. If youâ€™re not here for the updates, may I recommend fleeing this page and heading to any other of my blog posts for your enjoyment? Choose your own adventure among theseÂ topics:

  • New Years Resolutions, Artificial Intelligence, AI Leadership, Data Science, LLMs, Statistics, Decision-Making, Behavioral Economics, Decision Intelligence, Science, Bias,Â Data

Still here? Time for theÂ updates!

Here are some of my moments from 2023 that Iâ€™m most proud to share withÂ you:

âœŒ Having the courage to spread my wings and leave my position as Googleâ€™s Chief Decision Scientist after almost 10 years there. (Hereâ€™s my blog post about how and why I took the leap: https://bit.ly/quaesita_quit1)

ğŸ’ª Managing to stay kind, balanced, cheerful, and there for my family as I navigate being CEO of not one but two startups (the advising/speaking one that Iâ€™ve been public about and the secret AI one thatâ€™s so stealth Iâ€™ve never mentioned itÂ before).

ğŸ¤« Finding a (stellar) co-founder. You will freak out when you find out who it isâ€¦ all in goodÂ time.

âœ¨ Growing as a professional speaker as I strive to be the most approachable, sensible, inspiring, and funny voice on the topic of AI and human potential. I spoke in front of over 50,000 people (in person!) in places like New York, Oslo, Lisbon, Rio de Janeiro, London, Istanbul, Las Vegas, Belgrade, Copenhagen, Riyadh, San Francisco, Montreal, andÂ Milan.

People keep asking me what my secret is, so let me spill the beans. The reason Iâ€™m different from other AI speakers is my unique background:

ğŸ¤– Decades of being a professional in AI, data, and decisionÂ science.

ğŸ­ A lifetime of being a theatre nerd. Why did I do so much theatre training in my spare time? To feed my soul and because itâ€™s fun. Or maybe for the same reason people climb Everest.. just to see how strong they can get if they push themselves. Going pro was a totally unplanned happy accident. But thatâ€™s the secret of whatâ€™s different about me as aÂ speaker:

AI professional + lifelong theatre training = a damn goodÂ show.

This year, Iâ€™m planning to do even more speakingâ€Šâ€”â€Šgo big or go home! If youâ€™re keen to help me go even bigger (or if youâ€™re frustrated by the gender imbalance youâ€™re seeing in speaker lineups), please share my booking form with everyone you know who might be looking for speakers inÂ 2024:

https://makecassietalk.com

ğŸŒŸ Creating a fun online course to help everyone improve their decision-making (free here if you have a LinkedIn account: https://bit.ly/decisioncourse )

âœ Becoming a better writer and growing my Medium blog to 170k+ followers (whoa, thatâ€™s close to a one quarter of the size of the biggest *publication* on the platform). I also signed with an awesome book agent. (Letâ€™s do this!) By the way, my last blog post was all about the science of motivation and self-control, which you might find handy as you start the new year: https://bit.ly/quaesita_resolutions

But enough about me! What are your proudest achievements of 2023 and what are your goals for 2024? Let me know on social mediaâ€Šâ€”â€ŠIâ€™m excited to hear from you.Â ğŸ’–

Thanks forÂ reading!

If you want to say thank you, I appreciate shares and retweets. If youâ€™re keen to read more of my writing, most of the links in this article take you to my otherÂ musings.

How about aÂ course?

If you had fun here and youâ€™re looking for an unboring leadership-oriented course designed to delight AI beginners and experts alike, hereâ€™s a little something I made forÂ you:

Prefer to hone your decision skills instead of building your AI muscles? You can learn decision intelligence from me via this link to my freeÂ course:

The steering wheel for your life - Decision Intelligence Video Tutorial | LinkedIn Learning, formerly Lynda.com

P.S. Have you ever tried hitting the clap button here on Medium more than once to see what happens?Â â¤ï¸

Liked the author? Connect with CassieÂ Kozyrkov

Letâ€™s be friends! You can find me on Twitter, YouTube, Substack, and LinkedIn. Interested in having me speak at your event? Use this form to get inÂ touch.

Join Medium with my referral link - Cassie Kozyrkov
